data.event: Indonesian authorities are conducting tests on samples taken from a suspected bird flu patient who died on Thursday, May 5.
Encephalitis has been reported in other H5N1 cases, including that of a 67-year-old woman from West Java who died in October 2006.

event.title: the death of the 26-year-old man on Thursday

data.event: The Kedaulatan Rakyat, a newspaper based in Yogyakarta, reports that following the death of the 26-year-old man on Thursday, 125 of his neighbors have been examined for signs of bird flu and 34 have been tested for the virus.
The WHO has not had access to H5N1 samples from Indonesia since January when a dispute arose over the use of H5N1 samples from Indonesia in commercially made vaccines.

event.title: last year in Indonesia a 32-year-old man was probably infected

data.event: According to the WHO, last year in Indonesia a 32-year-old man was probably infected with H5N1 via his 10-year-old son (both died), suggesting that the virus had in that instance acquired the ability to transmit human-to-human, albeit in a limited manner.
